verses.verse: Dead <WH4194> flies <WH2070> cause the oil <WH8081> of the perfumer <WH7543> to send forth <WH5042> an evil odor <WH887>; so doth a little <WH4592> folly <WH5531> outweigh <WH3368> wisdom <WH2451> and honor <WH3519>.
A wise man <WH2450>'s heart <WH3820> is at his right hand <WH3225>; but a fool <WH3684>'s heart <WH3820> at his left <WH8040>.
Yea also <WH5530>, when the fool walketh <WH1980> by the way <WH1870>, his understanding <WH3820> faileth <WH2638> him <WH559>, and he saith to every one that he is a fool <WH5530>.
If the spirit <WH7307> of the ruler <WH4910> rise up <WH5927> against thee <WH3240>, leave not thy place <WH4725>; for gentleness <WH4832> allayeth <WH3240> great <WH1419> offences <WH2399>.
There is <WH3426> an evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under the sun <WH8121>, as it were an error <WH7684> which proceedeth <WH3318> from <WH6440> the ruler <WH7989>:
folly <WH5529> is set <WH5414> in great <WH7227> dignity <WH4791>, and the rich <WH6223> sit <WH3427> in a low place <WH8216>.
I have seen <WH7200> servants <WH5650> upon horses <WH5483>, and princes <WH8269> walking <WH1980> like servants <WH5650> upon the earth <WH776>.
He that diggeth <WH2658> a pit <WH1475> shall fall <WH5307> into it <WH6555>; and whoso breaketh through a wall <WH1447>, a serpent <WH5175> shall bite him <WH5391>.
Whoso heweth out <WH5265> stones <WH68> shall be hurt <WH6087> therewith <WH1234>; and he that cleaveth wood <WH6086> is endangered thereby <WH5533>.

If the iron <WH1270> be blunt <WH6949>, and one do not whet <WH7043> the edge <WH6440>, then must he put <WH1396> to more strength <WH2428>: but wisdom <WH2451> is profitable <WH3504> to direct <WH3787>.
If the serpent <WH5175> bite <WH5391> before it is charmed <WH3908>, then is there no advantage <WH3504> in the charmer <WH3956>.
The words <WH1697> of a wise man <WH2450>'s mouth <WH6310> are gracious <WH2580>; but the lips <WH8193> of a fool <WH3684> will swallow up himself <WH1104>.
The beginning <WH8462> of the words <WH1697> of his mouth <WH6310> is foolishness <WH5531>; and the end <WH319> of his talk <WH6310> is mischievous <WH7451> madness <WH1948>.
A fool <WH5530> also multiplieth <WH7235> words <WH1697>: yet man <WH120> knoweth <WH3045> not what shall be <WH310>; and that which shall be after him <WH5046>, who can tell him?
The labor <WH5999> of fools <WH3684> wearieth <WH3021> every one of them <WH3045>; for he knoweth not how to go <WH3212> to the city <WH5892>.
Woe <WH337> to thee <WH776>, O land, when thy king <WH4428> is a child <WH5288>, and thy princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> in the morning <WH1242>!

Happy <WH835> art thou <WH776>, O land, when thy king <WH4428> is the son <WH1121> of nobles <WH2715>, and thy princes <WH8269> eat <WH398> in due season <WH6256>, for strength <WH1369>, and not for drunkenness <WH8358>!
By slothfulness <WH6103> the roof <WH4746> sinketh <WH4355> in <WH8220>; and through idleness of the hands <WH3027> the house <WH1004> leaketh <WH1811>.
A feast <WH3899> is made <WH6213> for laughter <WH7814>, and wine <WH3196> maketh glad <WH8055> the life <WH3701>; and money answereth all things <WH6030>.

Revile <WH7043> not the king <WH4428>, no <WH4093>, not in thy thought; and revile <WH7043> not the rich <WH6223> in thy bedchamber <WH2315>: for a bird <WH5775> of the heavens <WH8064> shall carry <WH3212> the voice <WH6963>, and that which hath <WH1167> wings <WH3671> shall tell <WH5046> the matter <WH1697>.
